p.s: On November 7th, 2007 Barack Obama gave a speech in Bettendorf, Iowa as part of his presidential campaign.
The speech addressed to the people of Bettendorf and citizens of americaAmerica all over the nation and is about Obama's personal experience with the American Dream and American values.
He starts off by pointing out how he grew up in a nearby town and says he disagrees with people in the capital saying americansAmericans are divided.
Then, he talks about travelling around the country and encounting the hopes and dreams of americansAmericans, motivating him to fight for those wishes.

In the next part, he connects these dreams to his own family, first his grandparents, that believed in the american dreamAmerican Dream, when moving to the country after World War 2, and then his mother that believed she could achieve her goals even while being in government welfare programs.
He finishes off by connecting these hopes and dreams to his younger self, that decided to accept a small salary working as community organizer in Chicago just to lift people out of hopelessness.
All in all, Obama talks about meeting Americans and their dreams while travelling and his own family's history motivating him to fight for americanAmerican values and the American Dream.
